messages.message:
Hi Team,
When I attempted to create an app, I wasn’t aware of the warning indicating that some referenced fields were renamed, deleted, or moved. After clicking the *`Create App`* button, the process gets stuck in *processing* mode, and I'm unable to exit or proceed further. I've attached a screen recording for your reference.
cc : @Nithin
Yeah we should not allow for the creation of an when we have this issue. I think we should block the action

App generation is not guaranteed to fail, its possible to create an app that has fields with broken references.

That said I agree with blocking creation. Instead of showing a warning modal we can directly show the field reference error modal when the user tries to create an app. (and maybe update the copy to “Update affected fields before creating an app.“)
i like that idea! cc @melissa.amos for any thoughts

Agree to blocking app creation. If you try to create an app with unresolved references, I think we can do a combo of these modals:

*Resolve field references*
Custom functions or derived fields in this project reference fields that were removed, deleted, or renamed. All references must be resolved before you can create an app.
<table>
<!--no secondary CTA--> [ OK ]
---

<!--last few words can be changed to "update an app." if we need the same modal for creating an app version--->
@Serena lets discuss priority. I don't think this is frequent enough but don't have a way to tell that
